intro: Thesium linophyllon var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white pubescence. This variety is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained, acidic soils.
